Title: Co-Founder
Position-0-Description: We building TOOKEY - asset and access management protocol that intends to transform the enterprise private key management paradigm across Web3, DeFi, and Collectible platforms. The problem scope is massive: more than $500 million was stolen from only 4 protocols in December 2021 due to a compromised secret key issue. Cross-chain bridges remain a major target for hackers, with 3 bridges breached this month (October 2022) and nearly $600 million stolen. Current private key administration experience is absolutely off:  -Management of access is the complex and unhandled issue of many Web3 projects. -Automation of execution requires disclosure of private keys inside a semi-trusted environment, driving weak security. -Access control on smart contracts is limited by on-chain data and brings additional complexity and execution costs Tookey identifies threats of private key compromise and fraudulent transaction pushing, letting developers integrate and deploy distributed private key management solutions quickly. This is now possible due to the implementation of Threshold signature schemes. TSS allows several people to sign transactions using a single public key.  Pluggable Tookey's core components are the TSS participation library and the Key Service API. These components enable the development of third-party applications such as DeFi protocol maintenance tools, end-user wallets, CEX depositaries, escrow services, and many more.

Summary: Starting with C++ might not be what they call a good roadmap for programming, but it was the route I took. Over the years as a bachelor's student, I tried a few game development projects and slowly got interested in AI and ML. I loved the concept of having computers doing your job for you, so I did my best to learn more, and to create more urgency, I started teaching practical ML (or, as some would call it, coding) to Ph.D. students who didn't have a background in CS. Slowly but surely, I got better at it, which helped me choose my thesis for my master's degree more efficiently. To no one's surprise, it was on Auto-ML (basically, how we can let the computer do the job of a data scientist). Summary: Multi-lingual global professional who works at the intersection of entrepreneurship, digital products, and economic development. Co-founder at Cyber Key Ventures, an early stage global VC firm focused on cybersecurity and fintech, and co-founder at Grand Founders, a nonprofit whose mission is to support economic development in target markets through the support of their entrepreneurs. Previous successes include product marketing consulting for several acquisitions of insightsoftware, one of the world‚Äôs leading financial software platforms, as well as having supported several projects for titans like Google, MTV, Spanish TV channel Canal 4, and Universal Music Group, along with multiple early-stage startups and IT agencies. Significant research has been conducted into the economics related to corporate branding, country branding, and sovereign debt. Work and studies have taken place in Chile, Spain, Brazil, Ukraine, the United Kingdom, and the United States (DC, NYC, and Miami) in bilingual and trilingual settings. Y Combinator Startup School Graduate.

Position-2-Description: This was a contract role via my firm, Cyber Key Ventures, to conduct market research and advise USAID on the potential to support cybersecurity startups in Ukraine. We interviewed dozens of institutional and private investors, as well as accelerators and other private sector organizations, to determine what steps need to be taken to better attract outside venture capital investment. The larger program, titled 'Cybersecurity for Critical Infrastructure Ukraine', is a multi-pronged approach to shore up Ukraine's ability to protect the cybersecurity of its critical infrastructure.
Position-3-Title: Biz Dev, Marketing, and Product Development Consultant
Position-3-Description: Current and past clients include agencies, startups, SMBs, and enterprises. Clients range from boutique software design shops to large outstaffing companies that service top international enterprises. ‚Ä¢ Frequently consults pre-seed, seed, and series A level startups on their growth strategies. ‚Ä¢ Occasionally collaborates with enterprise-level organizations on specific projects, like MTV's European Music Awards, Google's ads quality rating system, and Spanish production company Molinos de Papel on a tv episode for its primetime show Callejeros Viajeros.
Position-4-Description: Cieden is a software design and marketing agency with operations in the United States and Ukraine. Its main practice areas in business analysis, product management, product design, and marketing are all leveraged to assist both startups and established enterprises with their goals. The agency had plateaued in its growth and was looking for an executive to smooth out internal operations, boost sales, and further diversify its service offering to include product management and product marketing. ‚Ä¢ Built an integrated marketing department that produced organic content strategy, branding, and social/PPC campaigns for clients. ‚Ä¢ Overhauled client management operations, including the implementation of account lead hierarchies and workflow scheduling. Result: went from an average of 60% employee productivity (=billable hours) to an average of 85%. Further initiatives, spearheaded by the finance department, further increased the number to ~90%. ‚Ä¢ Helped increase YoY revenue by 100-150% through a combination of operational improvements, internal one-on-one product strategy training, increasing the length of client contracts, and attracting higher quality clients.
Position-5-Description: Gridics is a real estate and government software startup whose suite of web apps assists both city governments and private sector real estate professionals in navigating the world of zoning and urban planning.  The company needed assistance in better commercializing its unique property records data and zoning calculations, in addition to introducing more structured agile best practices into its operations. ‚Ä¢ Conducted in-depth interviews with multiple municipal governments and private sector real estate professionals, culminating in a 25-page study detailing professional habits and most acute pain points. ‚Ä¢ Helped expand the company‚Äôs roster of clients to include NYC, Cupertino, and seven other municipalities, considering it started with Miami as its only city client. ‚Ä¢ Developed and drove the customer-facing side of a product roadmap that broke down two monolithic web apps into a series of APIs and microservices to allow for the creation of simpler, more targeted products that directly addressed customer needs. ‚Ä¢ Led brand positioning and product conception for new software solutions, while championing the integration of legacy products into one cohesive platform that is driving measurable customer growth. ‚Ä¢ Gathered, documented, and designed product requirements and general UX approaches for new software applications. ‚Ä¢ Directly managed and guided the design team. ‚Ä¢ Drafted an entirely revamped monetization strategy to capture a larger share of the market. ‚Ä¢ Adapted SCRUM / Agile best practices to the company's unique setup. ‚Ä¢ Largest impact: advocacy for one particular product line led to 70% YoY growth in 2019, with projections of 250-300% growth and minimal risk to market disruption in 2020 even considering COVID-19's impact due to the stability of government contracts.
Position-6-Description: Stradigys was an integrated marketing agency that focused on small and medium sized service providers primarily in the healthcare, real estate, and legal fields in South Florida and Atlanta. Stradigys has since been rolled into the in-house marketing department of Location Ventures, a Miami-based real estate developer. The company needed a Marketing Manager and Client Executive to help service existing clients while capturing new business accounts. ‚Ä¢ Quickly promoted to Senior Marketing Manager, and then Director of Client Services after successfully developing marketing strategies for existing clients while pitching for new clients. ‚Ä¢ Managed a full team of creatives and specialists to fulfill both traditional and digital marketing needs for the agency‚Äôs clients. ‚Ä¢ Helped optimize cross-departmental processes between sales and marketing with one client to bolster revenue, resulting in a 225% increase in sales for Ocean Land Investments‚Äô latest projects worth $250M. ‚Ä¢ Managed the company‚Äôs largest book of business, providing high-touch service to ~20 clients across multiple industries and supporting small and medium sized businesses, totaling hundreds of millions of dollars in annual revenue.
Position-7-Description: The Harry Fox Agency, later called HFA-Rumblefish and acquired by SESAC, is a music rights and IP technology company that automates licensing and royalty payments between record labels and music publishers, which represent songwriters. The company originally needed an account manager to service all Latin-focused record labels and music publishers, including foreign performing rights societies like Spain‚Äôs Sociedad General de Autores y Editores.  ‚Ä¢ After successfully serving all Latin record label clients, was promoted to Senior Account Manager. ‚Ä¢ Managed the agency‚Äôs largest multi-million dollar client, Universal Music Group, along with its affiliate labels and on behalf of music publishers, including Sony Music, Warner Music, EMI, and international performing rights societies.  ‚Ä¢ Assisted the Business Development Department in rolling out a new tech-heavy product to tap into new revenue streams ‚Äì namely, automated bulk licensing for ‚Äúsynchronized‚Äù song usage.  ‚Ä¢ Uncovered hundreds of thousands of dollars in unpaid royalties to Latin songwriters despite revenue tracking not being a core job duty.
Position-8-Description: The U.S. Department of Commerce teams up with the State Department in many countries to promote strong bilateral commercial ties between the United States and the host country. ‚Ä¢ Translated and interpreted negotiations between a U.S. construction company and a Spanish architecture firm to cement a $150M dollar deal for a joint venture in Brazil. ‚Ä¢ Compiled and managed targeted invite lists for events to promote tourism to Philadelphia and infrastructure investment in Texas.

Summary: We Deal SaaS is on a mission to simplify SaaS management: meaning helping companies finding, buying and renewing software subscriptions.  Making sense of your SaaS stack is often complicated and it leads to your company wasting tons of money on duplicated, redundant and unused applications. What makes it worse is that SaaS procurement is a broken process. Long evaluation cycles, lack of transparency, strong information asymmetry resting on the buyers' shoulders.  By partnering directly with vendors, we are able to guide companies through this process and ultimately offering lower-costs and better contract conditions. The result is significant savings on both time and budget.

Summary: To say I have an interesting background would be an understatement. Despite having two degrees in urban planning from an engineering school, my work experiences may at first seem random. But the truth of the matter is that all my career choices are driven by my passion to solve complex problems.  During the first half of my collegiate career, I focused on understanding and tackling the issue of climate change. I was awarded a National Science Foundation grant to compare and analyze how city governments in developing countries are creating strategies for climate adaptation. For my latter half, I decided to tackle an equally important and daunting issue in our society - the education system. By working on all ends of the education spectrum - from managing programs run by mega-corporations to researching international education policies at the OECD to college application consulting in the private sector - I've seen most of the institutions that shape our current education system and am still in the process of forming my own opinions of how I can best help improve the education experience for humanity. More recently, I became involved business development and operations because I wanted to learn how to take my big ideas and translate them to actionable insights. See, solving problems starts with understanding people and what the consumers/recipients want and need. So I've turned to the science of analyzing  big data, the art of qualitative research, and the strategy of marketing to further help me achieve my passion for solving complex problems. At the end of the day, I want to leave a legacy in this world, one that will brand me as a dreamer, doer, and someone with conviction.

This same model is pervasive in emerging markets, where each culture refers to a ROSCA under different names: - LATAM = 'Tandas'‚Äã, 'Cundinas'‚Äã, 'Pandero'‚Äã, 'Polla'‚Äã - China = 'Hui'‚Äã - India = 'Chit'‚Äã funds - Africa & Caribbean = 'Sussus'‚Äã, or 'Tontines'‚Äã Ahorro Libre is a Plug & Play Tech Center start-up camp company
Position-3-Description: Our journey started 5 years ago as Sonar Ventures. By that time we only knew that we didn't want to be an accelerator or an incubator, because of their model of investing in many different projects at the same time. We decided to make it different by choosing projects carefully and working on just a few at a time. Thanks to this strategic decision, to focus in quality over quantity, we became the first venture builder in Spain! We have created different startups, like: Lyra, Foodinthebox, Yump, The Element. We have sold a startup, Wysh, to Hotusa group, creating Hotusa Ventures. From this experience, we identified a new market need: Big corporations that want to create disruptive innovation, leading us to a new business model: corporate venture building.  With this in mind, we've created BYLD. We believe that with this model it's actually possible to drive real change by building a new generation of impact-driven and scalable startups.

Summary: I have been in the digital industry for 20 years (!) and, while I still feel like a developer at heart, my role and responsibilities have considerably evolved over time. I sit at the intersection of technology, product, design and business. I particularly enjoy enabling collaboration and ensuring that the teams I work with keep users and business outcomes at the heart of what they do. From a technical perspective I enjoy simple and effective solutions. I don‚Äôt have a preferred stack other than using the right tool for the job. From a delivery perspective I lean towards validating assumptions through small iterations released to the real world. I fully subscribe to Liz Keogh‚Äôs notion that a product or feature is never ‚Äúdone‚Äù, only ready for real user feedback.  All in all, what drives me is opportunities to be part of teams focused on delivering value and solving problems. Helping and guiding people, teams and organisations on that journey is an endless stream of challenges and rewards. I care a lot about diversity and inclusion, both as a moral imperative and as a necessity to build quality products and services. And while I understand that people and companies are all on different stages of the unlearning process, I expect a shared set of values and objectives from the people and companies I work for. It‚Äôs impossible to condense everything I have done or think about digital product development and the industry in a few paragraphs, so please don‚Äôt hesitate to ask.

Summary: Mission is to popularize systems thinking and simplicity through lens of design. These are not just buzzwords. These are important things that I had to undergo and learn through, things that reflect a large number of attempts to try out various things in design. ‚Äî Mom, who turns on the street lights every day? Since childhood, I have been passionate about researching different subjects, looking for a system in each solution, trying to find patterns and thinking about all the options for the outcome of the action. It‚Äôs always been in my DNA. I appreciate people who are looking for a system at every step, thinking about how to make it fault-tolerant and scalable. Sometimes I even thought that popularizing systems thinking was my destiny, after I came to my senses and realized that this was not only my plus, but also a minus. In simple tasks, a systematic approach prevents me from making decisions quickly. For this, I came up with development levels of a task and I use them every day. I am sure that the phrase ‚Äúsystem thinking‚Äù definitely deserves to be here. ‚Äî Ah, that‚Äôs why sometimes beautiful things work better It‚Äôs incredibly important to me how things look and how people feel when they use them. Emotions, emotions and emotions again. I am one of those people whose mood changes for the better when I am in a beautiful place or surrounded by beautiful objects. I‚Äôm trying to popularize beauty and aesthetics in my work as much as I can. ‚Äî Van, well, don‚Äôt complicate it! I often heard this phrase from my manager at the beginning of my career. The ability to make a complex thing is simple ‚Äî it‚Äôs worth a lot. I‚Äôm trying to find a middle ground between ‚ÄúI‚Äôll explain and sign everything right now‚Äù and ‚Äúlet‚Äôs remove everything unnecessary and make it simple.‚Äù It is infinitely important to reduce cognitive resistance and give a person as much information as he needs at the moment, no more. My kind of thing Simplicity ¬∑ beauty ¬∑ collaboration ¬∑ respect ¬∑ truth ¬∑ learning. If they are not there, I feel uncomfortable. Areas that attract me are communication, cars, travel, music, wine.

Summary: As a Master and Senior Technician in Occupational Health and Safety, 15 years of professional experience in the field of Quality, Safety and Environment (QSE), developed in Portugal, France, Netherlands, Belgium, Poland, Egypt and United Kingdom. Supervision, Consultancy and Guidance in the following areas: HSE Plan; Risk Assessment; Method Statement; Safe Job Analysis; Permit to Work; Emergency Response Plan; etc. In the exercise of QSE activity, acquiring skills in the execution of: Audits; Incident and Non-compliance Reports; Weekly and Monthly Safety Reports; definition and guidance of Safety Procedures (LOTO, radiographic and pressure testing; load lifting plan; confined spaces; work at heights; chemical risk; ATEX); Training; Instructions; Project Supervision and Management. Solid experience in the following issues of economic activity: Pharmaceutical, Dams, Refineries, Mining and Metal, Petrochemical, Chemical, Nuclear Plant, Hydroelectric, Furnace, Electric Substation, Oil and Gas, Tunnel, Wind Farm O&M, Shipyards, Railways, Offshore Production, Pulp Manufacturing, Beer, Bridges, Light Steel Framing, Telecommunications Infrastructure, Cement Plant and Data Center.  All the skills acquired based on solid academic and professional training of a continuous nature, which I will specify: A. Academic Background - Bachelor of Science Degree in Physics, completed in 2006 at Universidade de Aveiro; - Master of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering, specializing in Automation and Systems, completed in 2011 at Instituto Superior de Engenharia do Porto; - PostGraduate Diploma in Integrated Quality, Safety and Environment Management Systems, completed in 2011 at Instituto Superior de Engenharia do Porto. B. Professional Training - VCA VOL training, completed in 2014; - Graduated member of IOSH in 2015; - Confined Space training course in 2016; - GWO training course, completed in 2017; - GIES 1 and 2 training course in 2017; - Training for the use and verification of fixed and mobile scaffolding in 2017; - Training course on electrical risks in 2017; - CCNSG Safety Passport No. 6129402482, completed in 2018; - ATEX training course, completed in 2019; - Certified in ISO 45001: 2018 and in ISO 9001: 2015 Quality Management System, completed in 2020; - Diploma in Project Management in 2020; - Certified in ISO Management System Audit Techniques and Best Practices, completed in 2020; - Certified in Integrated Management of System Auditors, completed in 2020; - Certified in time management and organization techniques in telework, completed in 2020.

Most unskilled workers suffer from a set of difficulties such as: - large workload; - stressful routine in your day-to-day; - little appreciation of the profession; - low remuneration for the work performed; and - little free time for leisure and family. If you identified yourself with any of the difficulties mentioned, know that you are in the same situation as the vast majority of professionals. However, it is possible to alleviate some of these situations. I will give you my testimony of how I managed to bring about a change in my life. The growth of digital in the most diverse areas is indisputable nowadays. I found the solution through the incorporation of digital resources such as an e-commerce platform valued at more than 3000‚Ç¨. With the entry into this market of networking marketing you will flow from all orientation and become a networker, setting up your own online business. Several adherents to this work project have already learned to use technology in their favor and now, in an organized way, I am guiding them to achieve their goals of becoming a networker. Summary: Founder of TracknTake - a mobile solution that helps shoppers connect with their local stores and assists them throughout their entire physical shopping experience making in-store shopping simple, fast and enjoyable.  Thousands of the same products are being ordered online every day which then have to be shipped to each individual home because of the lack of understanding and communication between shoppers and their local retailers. Chances are, those products which shoppers are ordering online are likely already available within the same locality where the order was placed, causing the same products being shipped twice to two different sectors; retailers and shoppers. TracknTake creates a profound connection between shoppers and their local retailers to encourage for more in-store local purchases and product understanding before ordering those same products from outsider websites.

Summary: Founded my first venture, Byron Skatewear, when I was 16 (2010). Born as on of the very first e-Commerce DNB in Spain (alongside with other top players like Northweek) we managed to sell +45K items, be in +10 skateshops and create a loyal community all over the country (with a strong presence in el Maresme - Catalunya). After 8 years of learning and growing the company, we launched a new brand, Sunfire Bay, focused on woman clothing. It was meant to be our 'Roxy'. It quickly became bigger than the male brand and as a part of our catalog we started to sell sandals. In less than 6 months we were selling more shoes than clothing so we decided to focus on the shoe business. Weeks later, Step by Store was born. In less than 3 years we sold +100K shoes, had presence in +30 corners and created a community of almost 200K loyal followers/customers. On 2020 I decided to try something new, get rid of all e-Commerce headaches and focus on software and predictable revenues from subscriptions. With a top notch team, we built Vendfy, the first software that tracked Influencer Marketing conversion performance (ROI, revenue, sales, ROAS...) in Europe. Solving a problem we faced on Step by Store. Now on late 2021 I'm building the finest European CBD brand, Hippy, led by a hungry team of founders.

Summary: Lifelong advocate of football (soccer), equality, and positivity! For the past 15 years I have been committed to (re)designing football programs for physical and emotional wellbeing, equality and inclusion, and holistic talent development.  Over the years I have been a player, volunteer, coach educator, project manager, researcher, mentor, and director in football and football for good. I lived in South Africa between 2008 - 2014 (during which time I worked on the 2010 FIFA Men's World Cup social legacy initiative) and since then have been based in Europe (UK, Denmark, now Spain). For the past 4 years I have been part of the International Programs team at FC Barcelona Foundation leading sports-based social programs for children and youth who face systemic exclusion worldwide. I am also on the board and advisory board of several initiatives that are close to my heart.  In September 2022 I stepped down from my full time position at Bar√ßa Foundation to focus on building READY, which is an accumulation of my life journey, experience, and passion: innovation, tech and Web 3.0 to supercharge women‚Äôs sport.  Additionally, in a consultant capacity, I support several sport-based initiatives with social impact strategy, women‚Äô leadership development, and translation / adaptation of curricula and materials. I'm currently collaborating with Bar√ßa Foundation, Beyond Sport, International Olympic Committee, ChildFund Rugby, and Salford University. When asked recently: 'what does football mean to you?', I replied: 'Community, energy, and activism. It gets in your blood and connects you with inspirational people from all over the world'. Summary: Hi all, introducing Mauro!! Cheers!! I‚Äôm a geek, and I work as CTO at Freeda,¬†an International media company that reaches out to millennial women. ¬† In my past experience I have done quite a bit, I founded a consulting company ‚ÄúTeckHouse! S.r.l.‚Äù in the last years of college; then I worked at MTV/Viacom starting as maintainer of a small vertical platform and¬†in 3 years became the Web Architect of the SEMEA International Platform; after that I started as the first developer in a young startup, with the goal of automating the event tickets buying process (was the first platform in the world to try to do so, because believe me it‚Äôs not so easy to do:)) and with the growing of the company I become the Technology Lead. This startup is called Musement and is now one of the biggest in Europe. I have a passion for Home Automation, Tesla cars and Ducati Motorcycles; I‚Äôm a father and I truly love my family.
Title: CTO & Co-founder
Position-1-Description: dottori.it is a SaaS Platform, I was one of the two C-Levels of the company, and I have been commissioned to manage the product and development team. In less than one year I‚Äôve structured the teams, hired all members, defined the Roadmap, done the business analysis for each project and improved the B2B tool adoption by 360% and the B2C conversion rate by 25%. I‚Äôve started building the KPI Dashboard with all business and product metrics then focused on product development cycles to improve those metrics based on Business benefits and Development effort comparison. Six product owners reported to me: one for B.A., two for the User products (B2C and B2B), and three Technical Product Owners.
Position-2-Description: Freeda, the first Italian media brand that inspires and entertains a new generation of millennial minded women. Through our contents we foster and celebrate women‚Äôs achievement, free expression of personal style and sisterhood. I arrived after the first year of business, inheriting a micro-services infrastructure and a team to build. Company contents are distributed on social media platforms: Facebook and Instagram; I‚Äôm currently working in three macro-areas: the Content Management System for all publications, the data analysis solution with quantity and quality (in terms of sentiment and semantic) analysis; and the internal infrastructure for video production. The teams works using the Agile Framework with all rituals involved, in a truly micro-services architecture with an event dispatcher and listeners for the service orchestration.
Position-3-Description: Musement is one of the top 5 startups in Europe, chosen as best activity ticketing platform by Apple Store in 2014 editors. Its growing portfolio of international travel activities is available on the Web Site, both in Desktop and Mobile versions, and on iOS and Android mobile platform through website APIs. Musement platform is a very complex solution because wants to uniform an heavy jagged market with a simple and useful set of APIs. The API layer of the architecture will be used by front-end (tending to be in NodeJS), Mobile APPs and external partners, and enjoy of a ServiceBus that through a queue system manage all commands of the CQRS Pattern (Command Query Responsibility Segregation design pattern). We use a great set of OpenSource tools likes NodeJS, MongoDB, ElasticSearch and PHP/Python and the platform is deployed in two Clouds Services: Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure, centralized and managed by OpsCode Chef. I am managing the development team through Agile Methodologies. This means keeping focused on platform architecture and mobile technologies available to provide the best results in both flexibility and scalability while minimizing effort time. I can do this through a deep technical focus on emerging trends and development issues. Being a developer before than a manager means having the correct mindset to achieve company goals.
Position-4-Description: I am owner and founder of TeckHouse S.r.l., a company that provides services for creation and promotion of web image; we are an agile team of professionals and a deep knowledge of the web and social dynamics that together create a customized project that meets fully all the requirements of the customer to ensure the best possible outcome. Our greatest strength lies in the ability to provide timely and cost-effective technology solutions. OS Frameworks: Symfony2 - Zend Framework - Yii - Magento - CakePHP - Drupal - Wordpress - Joomla! - Mambo - Typo3 -OsCommerce - Zen Cart. SEO: Google Analytics - Adobe Omniture - Facebook Analytics - Facebook Insights - Twitter Grader - Twitter Score - Twitter Effect - ClickTale - UserFly - Crazy Egg  SEM: Google AdWords - TradeDoubler - Zanox
Position-5-Description: At 2013 end my team, thanks to the efforts done in previous years was acquired by Viacom and became the production team for southern Europe international cluster.  As core developer, I created a modified version of the Symfony2 framework in order to use: an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model, so the architecture can parallelize the various longs tasks required to render the web page through the use of an RPC queue system based on RabbitMQ; and a Multi-Kernel environment, where every app is an extension of the same base-code and set of library. The platform, already in production for the Portugal portal, will be soon accessible even in the countries of France, Italy, Spain, Greece, South Africa, and the Middle East. As database we use the international platform of Viacom via JSON APIs with which, by a system serialization/deserialization based on Guzzle and JMSSerializerBundle, we are able to obtain the content of the page. The response models, in some cases, are partially resistant on a local MySQL database to facilitate the aggregation managed with Doctrine ORM. The platform natively supports mobile device, boasts fully responsive interface based on Bootstrap CSS framework, and uses the NodeJS tools: Grunt, for Less compilation; and Bower for JS management. The structure server and is made ‚Äã‚Äãin amazon web service and resides in a VPC cluster, whose instances are in an autoscaling group. Log analysis is carried out via the interface Kibana, which uses ElasticSeach as an engine in which server and applications logs are saved by Hekad. The server software used remained unchanged from past projects and includes a reverse proxy based on nginx, and make use of web servers NGINX+PHP-FPM on CentOS. The system deployment was made in Capistrano via a plugin that detects instances in the cluster currently active and involved in application roles.
Position-6-Title: PHP Senior Developer - Linux System Administrator
Position-6-Description: I develop LAMP project for MTV Italy. I have managed the technical and functional analysis of the most visible projects.  The software architecture has built using the most modern design patterns. The realization is based on Symfony2 framework, of which I follow (attending national and international conferences) and participate in an active development. Other products are made with proprietary framework Object Oriented PHP5 Framewrok tuned for the service.  Database systems used vary depending on needing of the product, in some occasion I choose to use RDBMS system, such as MySQL, in others NoSQL databases like MongoDB and SOLR. The architecture of the network forecast the presence of a Reverse Proxy in NGINX with LUA scripts to maximize the effect of the cache and generate just two versions of the site relating to a user logged in or not with a RESTFul API software layer to serve user information. I also do an extensive use of in-memory caching system with Memcached and APC. Regarding the design of the web server I relied on high-performance systems based on NGINX and PHP-FPM. All this is developed in the Amazon EC2 Cloud that benefit the horizontal dynamic scalability. The operating systems used are all Linux CentOS and GNU/Debian. I also gave credit to the development environment and testing, realizing clones of the production system that also include systems of Bug-tracking, Ticketing and Versioning (GIT). All code is tested overnight through Jenkins a system of continous integration with plugins of unit-testing (PHPUnit) and code analysis (PHPMD, PHPCS, PHPLOC, PHPCPD and PHPDepend)
Position-7-Description: Musement is a digital, multi-platform booking service that allows travelers to find and book various tourist service around the world. Launched in Milan in 2013, Musement's growing portfolio of international travel activities is available on the Web Site, both in Desktop and Mobile versions, and on iOS and Android mobile platform through website APIs. They offered me the chance to work with them thanks to my score on StackOverflow, once inside the company I join a development team distributed throughout all Europe that works through platforms of Agile Development. We use the Atlassian stack in products such as JIRA for ticketing, Stash for code review and Bamboo (Capifony) for continuous deployment in development and quality server, and manually for the production cluster. The platform has been implemented within the AWS cloud and use services as CloudFront, EC2, Route 53, S3 and RDS, everything is handled dynamically by OpsCode Chef depending on the load of requests.  My main commitment in the company, in addition to cloud management, was to integrate the platform to external APIs for retrieving and booking of events. I had the way to study the most popular platforms such as Vivaticket, FNAC, Eden Viaggi, City Sightseeing, Encore. I could used various kind of APIs such as RESTFul (both JSON and XML) and SOAP. I also worked on the Adyen payment system and ENett for VANs generation.
